doc:div.p: This page describes the way we work with Mercurial on the RabbitMQ project.

doc:section.name: overview
doc:section.doc:heading: What is Mercurial?
doc:section.p: Mercurial is a fast, lightweight Source Control Management system designed for efficient handling of very large distributed projects.
We use Mercurial on the RabbitMQ project to manage almost all our source-code.

ul.li: RabbitMQ's Mercurial repositories are listed here. Individual project pages on this website will generally point you in the direction of the specific combinations of modules you'll need to check out.

doc:section.name: branchperbug
doc:section.doc:heading: Branching policy: Branch per bug
doc:section.p: We use the technique of branch per bug when developing RabbitMQ code, where each feature or bug fix is developed on a branch of its own (using hg branch) and merged into the default (trunk) branch only when the hurdle of QA is passed. We use our Bugzilla instance to track each work item, so branches follow the pattern bugN.
More information on this style of development can be found in the following links:
